title: Science Inquiry Competency Enhancement Program Using Flipped Learning: Advanced Experimental Design and Data Analysis (Focused on Variable Control and Evidence-Based Conclusions)

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced expertise in science (experimental design, data analysis, scientific methodologies) and self-directed learning experience; particularly requires foundational understanding of variable control, hypothesis testing, and evidence-based conclusions
context.additional_context: Customized flipped learning courses in a BYOD environment for medical, legal, and technical professionals. Continuous monitoring of learning progress through formative assessments, emphasizing scientifically applicable knowledge (variable control, evidence-based conclusions, scientific inquiry processes). In healthcare, focus is on clinical data analysis and scientific approaches to symptom observation; in law, on scientific evidence evaluation and experimental reproducibility reviews; in technology, on engineering problem-solving and experimental design optimization.

learning_goals: Learners will use a flipped learning model to complete ≥80% of pre-learning materials (e.g., scientific theories, experimental protocols, variable control methods) ≥2 times weekly. They will apply scientific inquiry principles when formulating hypotheses.

Learners will collaboratively develop and present ≥3 problem-solving strategies based on the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis → experiment design → data collection → analysis). They will specify measurement tools and analytical techniques for each stage.

Learners will maintain ≥90% participation in formative assessments and write self-reflective learning logs including experimental observations, variable analyses, and evidence-based conclusions. Logs must systematically document data collection and logical reasoning.

Graduate learners will apply data analysis techniques, experimental design principles, and evidence-based conclusion methods acquired in a flipped learning environment to write one case study linked to an actual research project or technical report. The case study must achieve ≥4/5 ("excellent") in ≥4 of 5 peer/mentor evaluation categories (relevance, creativity, practicality, logic, completeness) within 6 months. Scientific methodology and experimental reproducibility must be validated.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
